creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by Mr and Mrs Fred Levin, The Shenson Foundation in memory of Dr A. Jess Shenson
inscription:
欲倩啼鳥助長吟、無奈残香更下林。春逐江流溢之。晝闹?沈绿陰々。館娃宮冷歌合聲怒。燕子楼空廉影深。独喜老来交游絶、花𨒬不照？？紋。

I wanted to borrow the singing of the birds to help my poetic chanting, / But, alas! The lingering perfume now has withdrawn from the wood. / Spring has followed the river’s flow, full of burgeoning fragrance; / In daytime they enlivened the courtyard, where shade was rich and green. / The palace beauty – her chambers cold – the sound of her song so sad; / The fledgling swallows – their tower empty – the shadows of curtains, deep. / One thing to enjoy – as old age comes, social ties cut off; / Along the flowered path, now there’s no sight of footprints left by geta.) (SA) (see file)
markings: Square intaglio seal LLQ: 雲?氏; Japanese inscription on L side of scroll when rolled;
title: No Footprints
